page.title: 11DOVE HOLES COMMUNITY ASSOC.
page.content: This association,formed l2 years ago, purchased l0 acres of land adjacent to the village from ICI.l985 sees the final re-payment of a loan from the High Peak Borough Council.The cricket ground already existed. The football ground was reclaimed from quarry use. New buildings include a Scout & Guide hut,cricket score hut & football changing rooms opened in l982.The Over 60's hut is on Association land & junior footballlers have their own club. A BMX track will soon be constructed. After finishing a community hall & car park,a tree & flower planting scheme will be started. On the site is the neolithic Henge monument known as the Bullring. The bank & ditch remain but the stones have disappeared.
